question.title: Parse an URI with multiple hosts possible?
question.body:
I have a Spring-Boot app and need to parse a MariaDB-connection URL - for reasons.

spring.datasource.url = jdbc:mariadb://host1:3306/mydb

This worked well so far.

URI uri = URI.create (mystring.substring ("jdbc:".length ()));
System.out.println (uri.getScheme());  // mariadb
System.out.println (uri.getHost());    // host1
System.out.println (uri.getPort());    // 3306
System.out.println (uri.getPath());    // mydb

Now I introduce a cluster to my DB.

spring.datasource.url = jdbc:mariadb:sequential://host1:3306,host2:3306/mydb

Now my parsing does not work anymore.

The "sequential" I can remove. But not sure with the multiple hosts.

Can I handle that with URI or something similar?

Otherwise I need to build a RegExp.
